result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew D Sawyer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
*Pay costs
*Pay DNA Surcharge
*Pay Domestic Abuse Surcharge
*If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

*Comply with conditions as stated in 16CM123 
*Court will allow misdemeanor expungement if successfully completes all terms of probation and is approved by the agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Matthew D Sawyer in court with attorney Christopher G. Klingman. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 15CM483, 16CM123 and 16CM335.

11:01 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
State has complied with victim notification; no victim's appear in Court today.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CM483:
Count 1 - No contest 

16CM123:
Count 1 - No contest 
BTC:  Domestic Abuse Enhancer is stricken.
Count 2 - DRI
Count 3 - No contest 

16CM335:
Count 1 - No contest
Count 2 - No contest
Count 3 - DRI
Count 4 - DRI

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1 of 15CM483, guilty on Count 1 & 2 of 16CM123 and Count 2 is DRI and guilty on Count 1 & 2 of 16CM335 and Count 3 & 4 are DRI.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Klingman makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant does not wish to make a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
15CM483:
Count 1 -
Impose/Stay 30 day jail sentence - consecutive to 16CM335 
If probation is revoked, huber priveleges for work, counseling or any other reason the sheriff will allow
Jail sentence to be served on electronic home monitor if approved by jail administration and risk assessment 
Placed on Probation for 18 months:
**Conditions of Probation are - 
Pay costs
Pay DNA surcharge
Pay Domestic Abuse Surcharge
Comply with conditions in 16CM123
**Court will allow expungement if successfully completes all terms of probation and approved by the agent.

16CM123:
Count 1 -
Impose/Stay 120 day jail sentence to run concurrent with Count 3 and 15CM483 and consecutive to 16CM335 
If probation is revoked, huber priveleges for work, counseling or any other reason the sheriff will allow
Jail sentence to be served on electronic home monitor if approved by jail administration and risk assessment - will need to serve the first 60 days in jail
Placed on Probation for 18 months - concurrent:
**Conditions of Probation are -
No abusive contact with Mikela Lange
Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  Andrew Lehman
Participate in any counseling and assessments as recommended by the agent, including domestic abuse counseling.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time. 
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

Count 2 - DRI

Count 3 -
Impose/Stay 120 day jail sentence to run concurrent with Count 1 and 15CM483 and consecutive to 16CM335 
If probation is revoked, huber priveleges for work, counseling or any other reason the sheriff will allow
Jail sentence to be served on electronic home monitor if approved by jail administration and risk assessment - will need to serve the first 60 days in jail
Placed on Probation for 18 months - concurrent:
**Conditions of Probation are - 
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Comply with conditions in Count 1 

16CM335:
Count 1 -
20 day jail sentence concurrent with Count 2 
Jail credit of 2 days 
Jail sentence to be served on electronic home montor if approved by jail administration and risk assessment
Huber priveleges for work, counseling or any other reason the sheriff will allow
Jail sentence to commence within 60 days
Report to jail today for start date
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
60 days to pay or set up a payment plan 
Submit DNA sample

Count 2 -
20 day jail sentence concurrent with Count 1
Jail credit of 2 days 
Jail sentence to be served on electronic home montor if approved by jail administration and risk assessment
Huber priveleges for work, counseling or any other reason the sheriff will allow
Jail sentence to commence within 60 days
Report to jail today for start date
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
60 days to pay or set up a payment plan 
Submit DNA sample 

Count 3 - DRI
Count 4 - DRI
Plea hearing on August 11, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Defendant's Response to State's Discovery Demand filed by Atty Christopher G Klingman
Plea hearing on August 1, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 20, 2016 at 10:45 am.

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on May 16, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Matthew D Sawyer in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

10:01 AM Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

Matter is set for a plea hearing at this time.

16CM-123 Defendant has a new file, set for an initial appearance, there is an active warrant on it currently.

State does not have a plea agreement, requests to address the warrant and set further hearings.
Atty Drengler concurs.

BY THE COURT:
Court quashes the warrant in 16CM-123.
Atty Drengler received a copy of the complaint, waives reading and enters pleas of NOT GUILTY.
PTC to be set on May 16th, 10:30 am

15CM-483 to track.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 16, 2016 at 10:30 am.

records.addlTxt:
2:54 p.m. Defendant Matthew D Sawyer in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant received a copy of the Criminal Complaint
Defendant waives reading of Criminal Complaint
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties
Court advises defendant of right to counsel and can contact Public Defender's office for representation.

Defendant contacted the Public defender and is eligible.
bond vcontinue  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 10:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Matthew D Sawyer
Current: 11830 Angel Dr, Plover, WI 54467 United States  (Effective: 12-14-2015)
Prior: 647 Johns Drive #3, Stevens Point, WI 54481
CAP Services: Personalized Family Safety Plan and consents to contact filed by: M. L.

Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  *Makela Lang  *Unless the victim consents in writing and goes to CAP Services to get a Family Safety Plan and then files the form with the Clerk of Courts and District Attorney.  If filed, then no abusive contact with the above named.
If no consent to contact, visitation for the child must be done thru a 3rd party.
***12-01-15:   CAP Services: Personalized Family Safety Plan and consents to contact filed by: M. L.

ADA David Knaapen appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Knaapen states facts for anticipated charges of Disorderly Conduct/Domestic Abuse.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
Defendant is not currently employed. 

State requests a $500 signature bond with conditions as stated.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  12/14/2015  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 1
